In the present work, it has been shown that the layered compound of the homologous А

n O 3 n+2 series is formed in the (1– х)NaNbO 3– хCa 2Nb 2O 7 system near the boundary between the perovskite structure and layered phases. This compound has the unique ability to adsorb water from the air, which then decomposes into the oxygen and the hydrogen. The oxygen is embedded in the interlayer space PLS forming a layered compound with a greater thickness of the perovskite layer. The hydrogen evaporates, and its output is much greater than during adsorption and decomposition of water by the compound Ca 2Nb 2O 7. The restoration of the original structure of the compound Na 6Ca 4Nb 10O 32 after the desorption of water occurs at different rates, depending on the stage of the desorption at which cooling occurs.
